localize.text: A <color=#ff5622ff>‘Reception’</color> begins by sending an <color=#ff5622ff>‘Invitation’</color> to guests whom you want to invite. You’ll want to navigate to the ‘?’ to begin this process.
Select the episode you’d like to play.
With this panel, you’ll provide the set of books required to start the episode.
This screen shows the list of books currently in the Library’s possession. Select the needed book now.
Continue along with the final preparations for the Invitation.
When you’re ready to send the Invitation, confirm your choice with the ‘Send’ stamp.
Up here, you can see some bare information about the librarians who will participate in the <color=#ff5622ff>‘Reception’</color>.
In this section, you can view detailed information about the selected character.
Underneath, you can check the list of Combat Pages (cards) the selected character will use in the <color=#ff5622ff>‘Reception’</color>.
Info on the guests that have accepted the Invitation to the Library is shown here.
Select this bar (or press the relevant button) to start the battle when you have finished reviewing all available information.
You can check the books you have obtained from the <color=#ff5622ff>‘Reception’</color> here. If you have failed the Reception, this part will show the books you have lost instead.
You can check the Battle Symbols your librarians have obtained from the <color=#ff5622ff>‘Reception’</color> here.
Now it’s time to conclude the <color=#ff5622ff>‘Reception’</color> and exit the stage.
In this section, you can burn the books that you have obtained.

You can see what the books in your possession have to offer before burning them. These books are also used for inviting the guests of subsequent episodes, so it is recommended to <color=#ff5622ff>keep at least one copy</color> in your possession.
Here you can check the list of items that can be obtained from burning the book.
Press the relevant button to begin burning your books. You can burn <color=#ff5622ff>up to 20 books</color> at a time.
When the Scene begins, press the Spacebar to roll the ‘Speed Dice’.
When the Scene begins, press <sprite index=0> to roll the ‘Speed Dice’.
A higher Speed value offers the following advantages: - If the enemy’s Speed is lower than yours, you can redirect their attack to you. - Characters with higher Speed values will act first.
Please select the Speed dice on a librarian.
This is the librarian’s hand of Combat Pages (aka cards). Please select one of them.
Now select the Speed dice of an opposing character to target them with the attack.

By pressing Q or clicking on the icon, you can toggle Quick Mode. In Quick Mode, the action dice are rolled automatically during battle, allowing combat to play out smoothly. When Quick Mode is off, the player must manually roll the action dice in each engagement by clicking or pressing Space.

Quick Mode is a toggleable option. In Quick Mode, the action dice are rolled automatically during battle, allowing combat to play out smoothly. When Quick Mode is off, the player must manually roll the action dice in each engagement by pressing a button.

With this utility, you can automatically fill the librarians’ Speed dice with the Combat Pages in their hands. Targets are randomly determined. This makes the battle proceed quicker at the cost of precision and strategy.

These are visual indicators showing who the librarians and guests are currently targeting for attack. Toggle them by pressing 1/2/3 (Enemies/Clashes/Librarians) on the keyboard or by clicking on the icons.
These are visual indicators showing who the librarians and guests are currently targeting for attack. You can toggle them with the icons.(Enemies/Clashes/Librarians)
By pressing the Spacebar or clicking on the icon after the Speed dice have been rolled, you can begin the combat phase.
By pressing <sprite index=4> after the Speed dice have been rolled, you can begin the combat phase.
Please click on an opposing character.
Please select on an opposing character.
By selecting on the character, you can view the list of passive abilities they possess.
When you observe a character, you can also check their resistances to various damage types.
Please move over to this panel and select a librarian on this floor to move to the Combat Page list.
You can see the currently equipped Combat Pages here.
This is the list of Combat Pages owned by the player.
Here, you can customize your librarians’ appearance and dialogues.
You can check the Battle Symbols in the librarian’s possession here.
You can jump from the librarian information tab to the Combat Pages tab here.
You can jump from the librarian information tab to the Key Page tab here.
This is the list of Key Pages <color=#ff5622ff>currently owned</color> by the player.
That panel shows the information of the selected Key Page. You can check <color=#ff5622ff>the deck (aka Combat Bookshelf), passive abilities, and resistances</color>.
That panel shows the information of the Key Page currently equipped by the librarian.
Press the button to equip the Key Page to the librarian.
You can see the information of the newly equipped Key Page here.
The deck of Combat Pages is bound to the Key Page. Make sure to configure the deck after changing Key Pages.
Each floor will present you with a set of <color=#ff5622ff>Assignments</color>. Completing the Assignments will unlock an ‘Abnormality Battle’.
When the Assignments are completed for a floor, <color=#ff5622ff>a battle against an Abnormality</color> will become available. Clearing Abnormality battles will raise the floor’s Realization Level.

This is the Library’s current hazard level as perceived by the City. Raising the Realization Level of each floor will increase the Library’s presence as a threat. <color=#ff5622ff>The Library’s hazard level</color> will rise once the gauge is filled.
Some receptions are composed of multiple Acts. You can check the number of Acts in the reception here.
Visual indicators for the number of Acts and their order can be found here.
The floors that can participate in the reception are shown here.
This middle portion allows you to navigate the information of the floors that are currently available.
More floors will be unlocked when certain conditions are met. New librarians are shown on new floors.
You can view the information on the newly opened floor here. You can check the librarians, Floor Assignments, and Abnormality pages.
